description:
Are you looking to meet fellow sociology students and make new friendships?

Come join us on November 25th in the Arts Lounge (basement of Leacock) from 5-8 PM for a social and speed friending event!

Whether you are a first or fourth year, this is the perfect opportunity to share your interests, hobbies, fun facts, etc. and make new bonds with like-minded students.

We will be holding a social hour before the speed friending portion of the night with refreshments so please fill out the Google form (in linktree) to secure your spot and list any concerns or dietary restrictions.

We can't wait to see and meet you all!

COZY MOVIE NIGHT

Hello, fellow soci students!

As the weather is getting colder, nothing feels better than putting on your pjs and relaxing on the couch with your favorite movie playing!

Join us on November 19th at ECOLE living room (3559 university) from 6-8 for a cozy, Ratatouille movie night. This is the perfect opportunity to take a break from your busy schedules and hang out with other students!

Prepare to wear your favorite pjs, settle in with your blankets, and enjoy a cozy night in!

Snacks will be provided, but feel free to bring your favorite movie treats as well!

Be aware that we will start the movie at 6:00 sharp, so feel free to show up early around 5:45!

We can’t wait to see everyone!

SUBMIT YOUR RESEARCH!

Have research your friends are tired of hearing about? Come share about it at the UBCxMcGill Share Sociology event this November 25th at 7:30pm EST! Share Sociology is a virtual multi-university research exchange event that gives undergraduate Sociology (and other disciplines!) students the opportunity to present and discuss their research to other Sociology students across Canada, and network with each other.

If you are an undergraduate SOCI student who is working on their Honours thesis, have completed independent research for a course, or are RA-ing with a professor, Share Soci is a great opportunity to practice talking about and presenting your research to other students! 

To apply to present your research, please fill out the following form (paste into browser or find in our linktree) before 11:59 on November 8th! 
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScFwxe99EvPLVotw9jtPrPVKFHqHfsBLhGLTFJGG_AFQfIQHg/viewform?usp=sf_link

!! SSA Fall General Assembly !!

The SSA is holding its first General Assembly on Thursday, November 14th from 6-8pm in Leacock 15! Not only will this be the SSA’s first GA (probably in its history), but we will be voting on a number of important changes, including:

1) The ratification of amendments to the SSA constitution
2) Positions to be included in a positions book of the SSA’s stances on important issues (e.g. Palestine)

If you have ideas for actions or positions the SSA should take, submit your own motions or topics to be included in the agenda and discussed here: 
https://forms.gle/DY4ter3jsVJj5ZzT6. 

The deadline to submit a motion or topic is November 7 at 11:59pm.

If you are interested in having input in student governance and the direction the SSA takes, join us! We need to reach a quorum of at least 24 people to make any substantive decisions, so make sure to show up and bring a friend :) The GA is open to all McGill students in a sociology honours, major, or minor program. There will also be free food provided, so it will be a real party!

TLDR: Come to the SSA’s first GA to vote on some important stuff, there will be food!! You are encouraged to submit motions/ideas by November 7.
